alert.note: Alert for Cook; DuPage; Kane; Lake; McHenry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 8:02PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following areas, Cook, DuPage, Kane, Lake IL and McHenry. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 758 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms had moved out of the area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Any ongoing flooding will begin to recede shortly. - Some locations that may continue to experience flooding include... Chicago, Elgin, Arlington Heights, Evanston, Schaumburg, Palatine, Skokie, Des Plaines, Mount Prospect, Hoffman Estates, Oak Park, Glenview, Elmhurst, Buffalo Grove, Crystal Lake, Ohare Airport, Streamwood, Carpentersville, Wheeling and Park Ridge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
